definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

pinyin: zhong1 yang1 zhuan1 zhi4 ji2 quan2

sentences.chinese: 洛克是反对专制政府的。

sentences.english: 《Robber 》reflected the youth revolting the feudalism system.
sentences.chinese: 《强盗》反映了青年人对封建专制制度的反抗。

sentences.english: An absolute ruler can do just as he please.
sentences.chinese: 一个专制的统治者可以为所欲为。

sentences.english: I wish deep home firmly feudal autocratic parents and feudal thinking of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 祝家深厚牢固的封建家长专制和封建婚姻思想。

sentences.english: That if government's democracy or dictatorship. It matters.
sentences.chinese: 对于最终是民主政府还是专制政府，这至关重要。

sentences.english: Autocratic leaders tend to make unilateral decisions, dictate work methods.
sentences.chinese: 专制型领导者倾向于单方面做出决策，支配工作方法。

sentences.english: In the feudal society of absolutism derive the lilliputian of flatter the most easily.
sentences.chinese: 在专制主义的封建社会中，最容易衍生谄谀的小人。

sentences.english: Above all, an authoritarian state intolerant of dissent and a one-party political system.
sentences.chinese: 专制国家偏执地使用一党专制的政治制度。

sentences.english: Above all, an authoritarian state intolerant of dissent and a one-party political system.
sentences.chinese: 专制国家偏执地使用一党专制的政治制度。

sentences.english: I think the percentage of authoritarian households was highest in Asian-Americans.
sentences.chinese: 我认为，在亚裔美国人当中，专制家庭的比例最高。

sentences.english: Only dictators insist they know all the answers in advance of experience.
sentences.chinese: 只有专制者坚持，他们在体验前就知道所有答案。

sentences.english: Militarization of Japan, leading to autarchy, and war in China.
sentences.chinese: 日本的军事化导致专制统治及侵华。

sentences.english: Do not be to overbearing at the outset, otherwise you will not have any followers.
sentences.chinese: 不要一开始就搞专制，否则你不会有任何追随者。

sentences.english: In Libya, the fall of a dictator came faster than anyone expected.
sentences.chinese: 利比亚专制政权迅速倒塌，出乎人们的意料。

sentences.english: The people is held down by a vicious and repressive military regime.
sentences.chinese: 人民受着凶恶而专制的军政权的压迫。

sentences.english: In face of autocratic and political pressure, we will not be silent.
sentences.chinese: 面对强权和专制的各方压力，我们不会噤若寒蝉。

definition: centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
